summary: This document is an email chain from February 27, 2025, between FBI Victim Services Division personnel and an external recipient, likely a prosecutor's office. The FBI is attempting to coordinate and deconflict regarding the notification of victims about the release of names related to the Epstein case, emphasizing they are not requesting victim names. The external recipient expresses caution and insists on verification before communication.

persons.name: Unit Chief Victim Program Management Unit
persons.role: FBI Unit Chief, Victim Services Division
persons.context: Identifies themselves as a Unit Chief with the FBI Victim Services Division, reaching out to deconflict on victim notification regarding the release of names in the Epstein case.

persons.name: Supervisory Program Manager
persons.role: FBI Supervisory Program Manager, Victim Services Division
persons.context: Initial email sender attempting to track down actions related to Epstein and possible victim names being released, requesting a call.

events.title: Coordination on Victim Notification for Name Release
events.description: FBI Victim Services Division contacts an external office (likely a prosecutor's office) to coordinate and deconflict efforts regarding notifying victims about the release of names related to the Epstein case.
personsInvolved: Unit Chief Victim Program Management Unit

keyFacts: The FBI Victim Services Division is actively working to coordinate victim notification procedures regarding the release of names in the Epstein case.
The FBI explicitly states they are not requesting victim names, only seeking to deconflict notification efforts.
An external recipient (likely from a prosecutor's office) expresses strong caution, stating they never release victim names and will verify the FBI's identity before speaking.
The communication highlights procedural safeguards and inter-agency coordination concerns in handling sensitive victim information.
The email chain is dated February 27, 2025, indicating ongoing administrative activity related to the Epstein case years after the main events.
